context.note: This section only applies to KVM hypervisors. Skip this section if your system does not use KVM.
context.p: If you have a recent version of the KVM hypervisor (>=60) and guest VMs with Virtio drivers (available for both Linux and Windows), you can use Virtio for I/O of guest VMs. To enable Eucalyptus to use Virtio:

step.cmd: Log in to the NC server and open the /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf file.

ul.li: Set USE_VIRTIO_ROOT and USE_VIRTIO_DISK to 1 on CentOS 5, RHEL 5, and RHEL 6 NCs that use KVM or else instances will not start.
Set USE_VIRTIO_DISK to 1 if you want Eucalyptus to use Virtio for EBS volumes attached to VMs running on the node.
Set USE_VIRTIO_ROOT to 1 if you want Eucalyptus to use Virtio for the root file system disk of all instances started on the NC.
Set USE_VIRTIO_NET to 1 if you want Eucalyptus to use Virtio for the network card of all instances started on the NC.

taskbody.postreq: For more information about Virtio, go to KVM's Virtio page, or refer to KVM PV Devices.
